name: Screencheat
description: Screencheat is a ridiculous competitive split-screen first-person shooter where everyone is invisible, so players are forced to look at each other’s screens in order to win. Supporting both local and online multiplayer, combat in Screencheat is fast and furious with a wide variety of one-hit kill weapons.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows® XP or newer Processor: 1.4GHz or faster Memory: 3 GB RAM Graphics: Any from the last 4 years DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: An enjoyable game for those who think CoD matches are too slow.  Screencheat requires you to be on the move constantly whereas games like CoD, BF, and the likes all have their campers. In this game, other players can see exactly where you are(at least from your/their point of view) so camping is useless since they can see what you are seeing and kill you from behind. Because of that, you have to be moving non-stop while also glancing at the other three screens to see where the opponents are. It's a lot harder than it sounds because glancing at the other screens is a near requirement to survive however the intensity of the game makes it hard for one to glance away from your little quadrant on the screen. The maps are quite small so there is little to no moments for reprieve during a match lest you be blown away by a well aimed grenade. Certain map functions like air vents increase your mobility and allows you to do sneak attacks but be prepared to be shot out of the air due to the predictability of the air vents.   There are only two gamemodes at this time: A free for all Deathmatch and a King of the Hill match. A King of the Hill match is basically camping(if you can even call it that) at a specific location to gather points while waiting for the inevitable death to claim you in the form of a blunderbuss or a grenade. Deathmatch currently only supporst to 10 points per game so a player has to get to 10 kills max.   Currently, there are two maps available. The first is a Museum map with a huge fossil in the middle. There is a ramp that leads to the top, an elevator that leads you to the top floor, and an air vent that drags you to the floor below it. It's quite easy to score points on this map (IMO) because the ramp makes enemy movements extremely predictable. The second map is a garden with air vents on the bottom of the floor that can boost you to around the middle of the map or even farther. The map is slightly symmetrical in it's shape and is a lot harder to get kills on(for me at least). One positive note about this map is that in a 4 player server or 2 player server, the map's color changes so you can easily locate the enemy. In a two player server, one half of the map is blue while the other is red. In a 4 player server, the map is split into quadrants with a different color in each. Despite this, I still failed at this map compared to the Museum :p  A small thing to note is the kill feed which is EXTREMELY satisfying. More often than not, it gives a small line at the top of the screen that says '_____ creamed ____' or something that basically says that you got owned. A few times, the entire screen would be filled with the text in CAPS basically rubbing it into your face that you were killed or that you killed someone. It's hilarious but causes you to screw up because you can't see where you're going and you cam be killed by another player in the few short seconds the message stays on the screen. But it is satisfying XD
Everything I hate about split-screen in one game I absolutely love.

Introduction     Screencheat is competitive split-screen first-person shooter where everyone is invincible, so players are forced to look at each other’s screens and kill their enemies mysteriously with one-hit kill weapons in order to win.        Gameplay       Pros       Now you are allowed to do what you’ve been secretly doing in your whole life.     Bring back to my childhood memories where I and my brother or our friends played split-screen shooters game. We liked to glancing over at each other’s screen, so we could find and annihilate them. And we would be like “Get off of my screen area you ♥♥♥♥♥♥ cheater! Freaking eagle eye!” and we would start to fight. LOL. (During our childhood we were playing on Playstation one and two only apparently).     The person who did not really enjoy shooting game or even did not like shooting game at all before might falling in love with this type of shooting gameplay.      The platforms are built colorful in purpose I think. It's actually to give a clue to other players to give more accuracy and confidence to know where your enemies are. (Striking map design).     Really fun to play with friends.      Silly weapons     The game is so original. Never found any games that resemble to this kind of gameplay before.      Cons       Minimal contents (come on; need more weapons, maps, game modes, and other new improvements whatever it is just add more fun stuffs).    Not much people know this game yet.       Control     Fine control just like other shooter game.        Replayability     Of course will be back again to kick some asses fun with your friends.        Verdict     7.2/10

Okay, if you look in the dictionary for the word 'awesome', you'll see a screenshot of this game. The idea of this game is everyone is invisible and you must screen cheat to know the location of where they are.  The first thing I noticed when I opened up the game was the music. The music is fan-♥♥♥♥ing-tastic and it fits well with the atomsphere and most importantly the gameplay as well. The level desgin, I can't imagine how it could be better. The different colors for different locations makes it easier to know where your opponent is, not to mention the landmarks that serve the same purpose. There are shortcuts in the maps you can take to quickly get to another location quickly while throwing your opponent off aswell. Theres a small, but fun arsonal of weapons to choose from. Things from a candle stick to a big ♥♥♥ revolver for 360 no scoping n00bs. Also, funny player models to choose aswell. I was surprised to find Slender Man to be one ofthe selections, although all of the characters are one solid color, ranging from red to purple, but none-the-less keeps the atmosphere fun and entertaining to the eye.  If you were a person who played 007: Golden Eye as a kid and hated your neighbor friend for screen cheating every damn time with that small midget character, you will have a straight up nolstalgia attack. I more than reccomend you buy this game because they executed this game beautifully, gracefully, and hilariously.  13/10 Piggy Points

Screencheat puts a fun and intense spin on typical Competitive-Multiplayer FPS games by taking away a main element of typical FPS games and intensifying the use of another people rarely use efficiently. In this game, everyone is invisible, and it is really difficult to find them other than what the game title suggests you to do: Screen cheat, that being, looking at other players screens to determine where they are. Now by the sound of this it seems very difficult, but the intensely colorful environments and uinique areas of the maps make this far easy than as if this mechanic was in another game.  On top of this unique mechanic the developers make the game revolve around, the variety of gamemodes and customization are what make this game so much fun. From the classic deathmatch to capturing and running around with a pinata, playing this game with others is a true party (especially with 8 people at once!). Also, the customization, mutators, and silly announcers are sure to get a laugh out of you.  When I statrted out playing this game I had a hard time trying to kill ONE guy, let alone the other 3 at once (I started playing this right as soon as the game got out of Beta). Despite me failing hard at this game it was difficult to stay mad because the style of this game is just too damn funny. Instead of throwing my controller across the room I was too busy rolling around on the floor laughing. Of course eventually I got way too good at it and now people avoid me when I try to play, but that's another story.   So to sum it up: Screencheat is a funny spin on typical FPS multiplayer games that is sure to give you a good time with friends and just about anyone online.

This is one of those Why hasnt this been done before? games. Everyone who has ever played a multiscreened first person shooter with their friends knows about screen cheating. We've all blamed our friends for doing it, while simultaneously snuck a quick peek at their screens to gain an advantage. It's part of the experience. The guys at Samurai Punk have taken that simple Idea, and ♥♥♥♥ing ran with it. In this game one is forced to screen cheat. All the characters are invisible, so the only way to findout where someone is, is to look at their screen. and It's hard work. There is a lot of information you have to keep track of in a match. But, there are so much going on to help you. First off the level design is brilliant. Each of the levels, for now there are only three, and laid out and colored to let you know roughly where someone is just by quickly glancing at their screen. A quick peripheral look will tell you everything you need to know. Each shot you make also reveals your location with various particle effects. If someone tries to shoot at you, you will know where the shot came from. It's simple and intuitive. you are outfitted with a number of various weapons to actually do the killing, and these weapons are all ♥♥♥♥ing fantastic. There is a simple shotgun, but incredible effective. There are weirder things with the Giant bouncy ball launcher, and the 'Chargey Horse.' and some more standard stuff like a melee weapon (although this happens to be a giant candle stick), a rifle, and a grenade launcher. They are all Beautifuly designed and no one weapon feels more useful than the others. they each have their pros and cons and all have their idle situations. The trick is that you only get one per life, so choose wisely. There are a few bugs that need fixing, while we were playing there was an awful lot of simultaneous kills, and a few other random glitches. Nothing game breaking though. You guys, this game is incredibly fun. It reminds me of my time playing old fps games like Golden Eye, or Perfect Dark with a group of friends. but with such a new and refreshing take on the genre. Plus, It's an absolute delight to look at.   If you are interested in checking it out, you should watch our video of Screencheat          YouTube™ Video:  Let's Play: Screen Cheat! 【Fight like a Scrub Club!】

Screencheat. The multiplayer topic not many of us have said about since N64 day's of GoldenEye. But now, Aussie (yes!) studio's; Samurai Punk and Surprise Attack! Games have made a game where the only way to win, is to screencheat, and this game is called... Screencheat (not a very original name, I know). In this multiplayer only shooter that can be played locally or online (or a bit of both) has you and up to three friends battle it out in the five arena's that have been made, where you must only do one thing, KILL EVERYONE! But it's not that simple because, everyone is invisible so you must screencheat to know where they are. Obsiously, many of you will go; 'But wouldn't you only see your screen on an online match?' Well the answer that wheather you are playing online or not, you will see everyone's screen's. I really enjoyed this game, I played mostly with my brother and... it ruin's your LIFE! (ish). It's just so fun, knowing that your enemy is somehwere, but you don't really know where he/she is. My only real problem is that there isn't exactly enough content here, as I said, there are currently only 5 maps, FIVE. And while the six or so game modes including 'Murder Mystery', which is basically Cluedo: The Videogame. Maybe having Workshop support would fix this problem. I also found a few bugs here and there, but I'm sure they will be patched out. Overall, I really enjoyed this game and hope it is constanly updated. Not many maps and qutie a few bugs do ruin it a little bit, but the funny things that pop up after killing someone are just funny. For a game that recently came out, I enjoyed it, just make sure you have lots of friends. I'm giving it 8/10 Times I slamed my hand on the table because I got killed. (GO AUSTRALIA!!!)

Is the reason you stopped playing competitive FPS games is that irritating-as-sh*t-kid that screen'hopped' (as we call it in Denver) and beat you every time? Or are/were you that kid that owned everyone in Goldeneye and Halo because you cheated?  Then this is the game for you.  Pros: -Well designed Local Multiplayer -Fantastic with three-four friends -Easy to use controls -Colorful maps that make the game easier to pick up -No learning curve if played FPS games -Great play modes, including a mode where all players only get one shot, then wait until everyone else has taken one until they shoot again (or the timer runs out) -All around hilarity and fun -Available on the HumbleBundle Store, so you can feel good about buying the game  Cons: -Boring with only two people -Playing online is a nice feature, but isn't nearly as much fun when not with friends -In-game voice chat ay help if added, but steam chat works if playing with friends -Not too much variety in maps, so they can get old quickly. But still fun for a couple hours every other week  In the end, this game is well worth owning. It won't be your most played, but it is a great party game like Starwhal or Mount Your Friends. If nothing else, support the game for being clever and the first (and probably last) of it's kind.

Screencheat is full of what I love in a video game; fun, action, and changing experiences. Every time you scream and realize that you just got hobby horsed frrom behind, or realize that you shot your only bullet at nobody, this game becomes so entertaining to me. Each weapon provides a new thrilling approach, and the concept of having to keep track of so much at the same time thrills me constantly. Finally, the game never feels stale because it is always different. Never do you 'figure it out' and master the game and just spam something- the screen cheat element makes nothing quite that simple.  All in all, I love the concept, the graphics are good enough for my tastes, though they could be better, and the weapons are nice. Though I think balance might need a little work- sometimes I wonder about the hobby horse.  My only complaint is about the maps. Sure, they're nice, they let you easily screencheat, yes, the colors are nice. But the actual level design itself leaves a little to be desired. Maybe it's that I feel that all of the maps were too similar, or that there weren't enough, but I think that they are the game's greatest flaw. A level designer tool or a mpa pack being released would probably fix that problem, but at the moment, it feels slightly limited.  But if you have 4 people who like to play, this is still a blast.

I wanted to like it. FPS games are fun, and so are local mp games. But Screencheat is a one trick pony due to its obscure game mechanic of invisible players. Aiming is incredibly difficult even if you know almost exactly where your opponent is, and after a while the difficulty in aiming becomes unfun. The alternate game modes and mutators add nothing to the experience due to poor design. Screencheat alters the core game mechanics of FPS games too much, and is therefore not comparable to games such as Perfect Dark or 007 or Halo. Splitscreen is a wonderful thing, and screen looking is a fun part of split-screen games, but invisible players just don't work.  Buy Towerfall instead.
